clinical_study.brief_title: ASS-Nonresponse Following Cardiac Surgery as Assessed With Multiple Electrode Aggregometry
clinical_study.official_title: ASS-Nonresponse Following Cardiac Surgery as Assessed With Multiple Electrode Aggregometry

brief_summary.textblock: It is the aim of the present study to assess the prevalence of ASS-Nonresponse following cardiac surgery using the Multiple Electrode Aggregometry (MEA).

detailed_description.textblock: Up to now there are no data concerning the prevalence of ASS-Nonresponse following surgical coronary revascularization procedures as assessed with the Multiple Electrode Aggregometry. Results of the present observational study are needed to assess the prevalence of ASS-Nonresponse in order to perform a sample size analysis for a prospective interventional study in a second step.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at day 3 and 5 after the first dose of aspirin following surgery
primary_outcome.description: Area under the aggregation curve following stimulation with arachidonic acid in the Multiple Electrode Aggregometry (MEA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at day 3 and 5 after the first dose of aspirin following surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the aggregation curve in the Multiple Electrode Aggregometry following stimulation with thrombin receptor activating peptide 6

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at day 3 and 5 after the first dose of aspirin following surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Platelet count taken from the daily standard laboratory results.
Mortality will be assessed by a telephonic follow up interview 12 month after enrollment into the study
Occurrence of a myocardial infarction during the 12 month following surgery assessed in a telephonic follow up interview.
Did a readmission to hospital due to cardiac or pulmonary reasons take place in the 12 month following enrollment into the study? Assessed by a telephonic follow up interview.

other_outcome.description: Age of the patient in years at the time of enrollment
Height of the patient in centimeters at the time of enrollment
Weight of the patient in kilograms at enrollment
LDL cholesterol of the patient in mg/dl at enrollment
Smoking habits of the patient will be documented at enrollment in the categories: active smoker non smoker

other_outcome.measure: European system for cardiac operative risk evaluation (EuroSCORE)
other_outcome.description: EuroSCORE as assessed on admission will be documented.

Risk factor diabetes will be documented in the following categories at enrollment: Diabetes Typ I Diabetes Typ II without the need for insulin substitution Diabetes Typ II with the need for insulin substitution
The surgical procedure performed will be documented.
The phone will be documented for the 12 month follow up interview.

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing surgery for coronary revascularization.

study_pop.textblock: Patients following cardiac surgery and a antiaggregatory therapy with aspirin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 18 years after cardiac surgery
- Antiaggregatory therapy with aspirin postoperatively
Exclusion Criteria:
- known allergy to aspirin
- need for an antiaggregatory therapy other than aspirin
- pregnancy
